articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Phil Stewart, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Iran and Israel traded air and missile strikes as the world braced on Monday for Tehran's response to the U.S. attack on its nuclear sites and U.S. President Donald Trump raised the idea of regime change in the Islamic republic.
articles.title: Iran weighs retaliation against U.S. for strikes on nuclear sites

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich
articles.description: An overnight Russian drone and missile attack in and around Kyiv killed one person, sparked fires in residential areas and damaged an entrance to a metro station that serves as a bomb shelter, Ukrainian authorities said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia's attack on Kyiv region kills one, sparks fires, Ukraine says

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday raised the question of regime change in Iran following U.S. strikes against key military sites over the weekend, as senior officials in his administration warned Tehran against retaliation.
articles.title: US warns against Iran retaliation as Trump raises 'regime change'

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Commercial satellite imagery indicates the U.S. attack on Iran’s Fordow nuclear plant severely damaged - and possibly destroyed - the deeply-buried site and the uranium-enriching centrifuges it housed, but there was no confirmation, experts said on Sunday.
articles.title: Satellite images indicate severe damage to Fordow, but doubts remain

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea said on Monday it strongly condemns the U.S. strikes against Iranian nuclear facilities as a grave violation of a sovereign state's security interests and territorial rights, the North's state media reported.
articles.title: North Korea condemns US strike on Iran as violation of sovereign rights

articles.author: Jamie Freed, Steven Scheer
articles.description: Israel briefly reopened its airspace on Sunday and is expanding flight operations on Monday, aiming to help tens of thousands of travellers stranded by widespread cancellations across the Middle East after the U.S. attacked Iran.
articles.title: Israel starts 'rescue' flights as airlines reroute across Middle East

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Monday that Canberra supported the United States strike on Iran and called for de-escalation and a return to diplomacy.
articles.title: Australia says it supports US strike, calls for return to diplomacy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is planning to cancel his attendance at the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO) summit in the Hague, a source with direct knowledge said on Monday.
articles.title: Japan Prime Minister Ishiba to skip NATO summit, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan called on Monday for de-escalation of the conflict in Iran and said U.S. strikes demonstrated Washington's determination to prevent Tehran from acquiring nuclear weapons.
articles.title: Japan calls for de-escalation of Iran conflict

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's President Lee Jae Myung named veteran lawmaker Ahn Gyu-back as the country's first civilian defence minister in 64 years on Monday, making good on a campaign promise made after December's martial law shook faith in the military.
articles.title: South Korea's Lee names first civilian defence minister in decades
